lines.text: Who here wants to be an ad-man?
[several hands go up]
Who here wants to be a fire engine?
[everyone raises their hands, with several standing and commenting things like "Ooh, I do!" and "Me! Pick me!"]
It helps you go to the toilet. If you don't use it, you'll get cancer and die.
[Reading a magazine ad]
"Paramount Pictures presents 'The Freak.' This movie won't just scare you, it will fuck you up for life." I want to know how the fuck the word "fuck" gets in the New York fucking Times!
Harris. Say something honest, no holds barred. GO!
I like... small boys.
About the product, you fucking idiot!
You may think phone service stinks since deregulation, but don't mess with us, because we're all you've got. In fact, if we fold, you'll have no damn phones. AT&T - we're tired of taking your crap!
[Drucker is being interviewed on Larry King's TV program]
Total honesty in advertising began as a vision I had when I was a young ad man in Milwaukee...
I don't believe that jerk!
I like Larry King!
I'm talking about Drucker! He took all the credit!
Pretty girls are breaking everybody's back.
But you're pretty. I mean, really pretty.
Yes, but I don't have the problems normally associated with prettiness... because, when I was a child, I looked like Ed McMahon.

[character can't say anything except variations on "Hello"]
Hello. How the hell are ya?
Hold me. Please hold me.
I am holding you.
I know, but it's a woman thing. I have to say it.
We can't level, you crazy bastard, we're in advertising!
Porsche. It's a little too small to get laid IN, but you get laid the minute you get out!
Take me away from here; I'll buy you dinner, I'll buy you a restaurant!
I have to go.
You did quite a bit of silent farting in the car, so you're not perfect either.
